lines.text: This job's going to be harder than... trying to right a rhinoceros.

[when seeing the Vienna hotel for the first time]
There's gonna be sex and violence.

[narrating]
So we dream on, inventing our lives; a little lost sister, a saintly mother, a hero father. But our dreams escape us however vividly we imagine them. There's only one thing you can do, keep passing the open windows.
If we can't get strong from what we lose, what we miss, what we want and can't have... then we could never get strong enough, could we? What else makes us strong?

[On finding Bitty passed out in the bathroom]
Passed out while diaphragming herself.
My daughter was a necessary phase?
